resources.string: Large bear of the Ursidae family. Can weigh 130–700 kg (300–1500 pounds).
Subspecies of Brown Bear. Adult males weigh on average 180–360 kg (400–790 lb).
Marsupial in the family Vombatide. It is a medium sized animal that makes a burrow by digging holes in the ground.
Small to middle size lizards. Many kinds of geckos can walk on walls, windows and ceilings.
A large group of elapid snakes. Coral snakes have notable red, yellow/white, and black colored banding. Coral snakes possess a pair of small fangs to deliver their venom.
A tortoise or land turtle is a reptile of the order Testudines that lives on land. Like their aquatic cousins, the sea turtles, tortoises are shielded from predators by a shell.
Mostly across northern North America and Eurasia.

The species is now found in Alaska, south through much of western Canada, and into portions of the northwestern United States (including Idaho, Montana, Washington, and Wyoming), extending as far south as Yellowstone and Grand Teton National Parks, but is most commonly found in Canada.
Species occur globally and are particularly species-rich in tropical areas.

New World coral snakes exist in the southern range of many temperate U.S. states. Coral snakes are found in scattered localities in the southern coastal plain from North Carolina to Louisiana, including all of Florida.
